alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 2:18PM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Muddy Boggy Creek near Farris affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-050730- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.Y.0005.000000T0000Z-220506T1200Z/ /FRSO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 218 PM CDT Wed May 4 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Muddy Boggy Creek near Farris. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Low-lying agricultural lands and rural roads along the creek in southeastern Atoka County may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The Muddy Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 40.4 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
